item.title: Fizzbuzz
item.author: Manuel Alfaro
item.description: FizzBuzz The FizzBuzz problem is a classic test given in coding interviews. The task is simple: print integers 1 to N. For example we can find one example in HackerRank with the next description: Write a short program that prints each number from 1 to 100 on a new line. For each multiple of 3, print “Fizz” instead of the number. For each multiple of 5, print “Buzz” instead of the number.

item.title: About Me
item.author: Manuel Alfaro
item.description: Hi ‚úã I’m Manuel Alfaro ‚ùì I’am Software Developer so I decided writte a blog to record my learning and share it with you, ademas me sirve como recordario. it also is a reminder about what I’m learning üìñ I taked a course at LaunchX from @innovaccionvirtual powered by Microsoft and one of my mentors was @Carlogilmar who motivated us to start a blog using Hugo and GitHub Pages technology.
